Welcome to meow.social!

A furry mastodon instance.

Admin members :

  • @Tiwy57
  • @Nomaxice
Moderators :
  • @DekiSystem
  • @BlurTheFur
  • @Dracodare
  • @KinkyKobolds
Official Accounts :
  • @TransparencyReports
  • @meow
Do want to contact us ? Please use this form https://tiwy57.me/page/meow.html.

This instance is focused around the furry community, and is open to anyone interested in it. It was created by @Tiwy57 originally for a small group of furry friends, but thought it might as well be open to all fluffies and scalies !

Meow is federated to nearly all instances of the fediverse, which means you can follow pretty much anyone you want, no matter what instance they are on!

While it is open publicly, mind this is just one instance in the fediverse, and we encourage you to look at other instances available to be sure it’s the one you like, and if none please you and you got the knowledge to set things up, why not help the fediverse grow by making your own instance too!

If you like meow, consider donating something via Liberapay, Patreon, Ko-fi or paypal!

Meow's thumbnail is courtesy of @wizlicos!

Indexing content on meow.social.

As a general rule, any form of indexing/scraping/collection of data of this instance for subsequent export or analysis processing without explicit expressed written consent of each user is prohibited and is unauthorized.

In the same way, using meow.social to train automated learning models (AI) in order to extract different information and also for the purpose of analysis without the consent of the administrators is prohibited.

If you are a student, analyst, or journalist, please contact us via our contact form and specify your needs: https://tiwy57.me/page/meow.html

Regarding moderation

  • About reporting
    • If actions from users on other instances break our rules, check ifthe rules of the instance to which the user belongs are also broken before activating the "Forward to [instance]" option. You can go to the instance's "about/more" or similar "about" / "rules" sections to check. Instances that do no have any rules listed anywhere are de facto considered as unmoderated and will be suspended, you can specify the unmoderated nature of the source instance in your report.

      • Failure to respect any of rules will lead to a warning, content removal, silencing, and/or suspension of your account.

      The Teams have the absolute right to decide to delete your account at their discretion.

      We reserve the absolute right to take any actions regarding any instances that are connected with this instance. If your instance is detrimental to the overall good functioning of the fediverse or meow.social, we will silence or completely suspend it.

      You may discuss with the admins if you feel you were unfairly sanctioned (through DMs or by sending us an email if your account is suspended), so long as you don’t try and force your way after the final statement has been decided.

      If you require any help or need to contact us, reach us through contact form at https://tiwy57.me/page/meow.html

      Emoji artwork is provided by Emojitwo, originally released as Emojione 2.2 by Ranks.com with contributions from the Emojitwo community and is licensed under CC-BY 4.0.

Description:
About mathstodon.xyz

Mathstodon.xyz is a Mastodon instance for people who love maths.

This instance is for people who love maths and we hope there’ll be lots of maths chat, but any topic of conversation following the code of conduct and the principle of getting along together is OK.

How to use LaTeX

You can use LaTeX in toots here! Use \( and \) for inline, and \[ and \] for display mode.

LaTeX is only rendered in the web interface, and not on all Mastodon instances. If the layout of your LaTeX code isn't too complicated, you can replace it with unicode characters by clicking the preview rendering below the post entry area before writing the closing delimiter.

Who's in charge

Operated voluntarily by @christianp and @ColinTheMathmo.

Supporting this instance

If you'd like to contribute towards the running costs of mathstodon.xyz, you can send us some money through Ko-Fi, either as a one-off or recurring payment.

If you'd like to show your support for mathstodon.xyz in real life, you can buy a t-shirt featuring our lovable mascot.

If you want to run your own instance with LaTeX rendering

The forked version of Mastodon that this instance runs is available at github.com/christianp/mastodon.

Code of conduct

We’re keen to make sure that Mathstodon is great for everyone.

Users violating the server's rules may have their accounts suspended and will not be welcome to take part any more.

If you are subject to or observe any harassment, or have any other concerns, please report the toot concerned or message a moderator. Reports will be dealt with discreetly and in confidence.

Please be aware of your surroundings and the effect your words and actions have on the people around you. We want everyone to have a great time, and treat each other with respect.

Wiki and status page

There's a wiki at wiki.mathstodon.xyz. When the service is unavailable, check the status page.

CONTACT US

Feel free to message or tag any of the following members of our mod team or the general account @moderation. You can also tag posts with the hashtag #KolektivaMod.

  • Acracia | he/him | @acracia | Portuguese/Spanish
  • Anarchy Peppermint Butler | he/him | @a_pepbut | English/French
  • Djab Maroon | he/him | @djabmaroon | French/Haitian Creole/English
  • Eme | they/them | @m | Portuguese/English/Spanish
  • Justin | he/him | @just1602 | French/English
  • Mud | he/him | @Mud | German/Spanish/Catalan/English
  • subMedia | he/him | @subMedia | English
  • 8787sook | he/him | @subMedia | English/French

Additionally, please note that @admin is not a part of the mod team.

KOLEKTIVA.SOCIAL CODE OF CONDUCT

Coming up with this policy has been a bit of a balancing act. On the one hand, we do not want to make too many hard-and-fast rules. We are anarchists, and therefore, we do not care to think too long about how to govern every aspect of how other people should behave. On the other hand, don't want our collective resources to be used to spread ideas that go against our values. To this end, we have come up with the following guidelines. We plan on adapting and changing these guidelines over time, and are open to feedback, critique, and suggestions from other Mastodon users, moderators and administrators.
As a user of this platform, please be mindful that your username ends with @kolektiva.social and your actions, in part, represent the instance. Your engagement builds an expression, and the values you share reverberate from within and outside this digital neighbourhood.

WHAT YOU SHOULDN'T POST AT ALL:

Posts containing the following content will be removed, and users will have their accounts immediately suspended and/or deleted.
  • Racist, misogynistic, transphobic, homophobic, ableist slurs, or other derogatory pejoratives for oppressed identity groups (unless you belong to that group and are reclaiming the term)
  • Blatantly racist, casteist, ableist, sexist, transphobic, or otherwise chauvinistic and bigoted discourse
  • Symbols and slogans associated with fascist regimes and/or fascist, third-positionist, western chauvinist or white nationalist movements
  • Arguments that seek to deny or cast doubt on historic or ongoing acts of genocide
  • Pornographic and/or sexualized images depicting people who did not consent to their image being shared
  • Pedophilia/MAP content, in all its manifestations
  • Purposeful misinformation
  • Spam

WHAT YOU SHOULDN'T REALLY POST:

Kolektiva.social is an anarchist/anti-colonial instance. Posts containing the following content may be reported and/or removed, and the user may be issued a warning. Repeated warnings may lead to accounts being suspended, and/or their users being encouraged to migrate their account to another instance.

  • Propaganda from politicians or political parties that seek to win elections
  • Propaganda from the USSR, CCP, or DPRK
  • Glorification of nation states and/or militarism
  • Messages promoting capitalism or meritocracy
  • Messages promoting or encouraging pseudoscience, conspiracism, or breaks with reality
  • Targeted harassment (i.e. evading blocks, repeated hostile replies, or posts intended to instigate brigading/dogpiling against a user or another instance), even for righteous reasons
  • Posts that could bring avoidable legal repression down upon Kolektiva's admins and/or server infrastructure (i.e. doxxing individuals paired with explicit calls for violence or threats against them)
  • Religious proselytizing/recruitment

    • POSTS THAT SHOULD BE ACCOMPANIED WITH A CONTENT WARNING:

    We have neither the capacity nor the slightest interest in monitoring all content posted on Kolektiva.social, nor do we enjoy making judgments about what is, or is not, acceptable speech. For this reason, we encourage people to use Mastodon's built-in Content Warning (CW) tool to label posts that other users may find upsetting. Unlabeled posts that are reported to us as containing the following content will have a Content Warning added to them, and the user will be notified.

    Accounts that regularly post the following types of posts without Content Warnings may have their accounts silenced, or suspended, based on the severity of the behavior, and may be asked by the moderators to migrate to another instance.
    • Any visual depiction of nudity
    • Any visual depiction of blood, severe injuries, torture, murder, or medical procedures
    • Any unambiguous visual depictions of drug use or drug paraphernalia
    • Any message detailing sexual acts
    • Any message mentioning suicide, self-harm, abuse, rape, or sexual assault that does not relate to a current issue
    • Spoilers (within reason)

    Apart from what is itemized above, we do not have specific guidelines for Content Warnings. All users are encouraged to be considerate of others’ needs and preferences, particularly with respect to things that are widely considered repulsive or distressing (for example, the worst events in human history and the worst things that people can do to each other).

    We explicitly do not, and never will, require users to tag political content and news-related posts.

    Special Cases Worth Extra Explanation:


    Nudity, sex, drugs, and drug paraphernalia. We want Kolektiva.social to be as accessible as possible to minors, incarcerated people, and others whose internet access is monitored. These subjects, when visible on the public timeline, may lead to authorities speedily and irreversibly blacklisting our website in a way that political content may not. For this reason, and some others, we ask that all images depicting these subjects be accompanied with a Content Warning.

    The COVID-19 pandemic. COVID-19 is a real disease, and vaccines and masks are useful measures for impeding its spread. We will treat messages to the contrary as either "Purposeful misinformation" or "Messages promoting or encouraging pseudoscience, conspiracism, or breaks with reality" as itemized earlier. It's not that we think various "experts", on health subjects or others, are entirely beyond questioning. It's simply that we also disdain our platform being used to spread health myths that are, by and large, generated and boosted in the same parts of the internet as far right conspiracy theories about the present order.

    The Russo-Ukrainian War. We do not want our instance flooded with pro-war propaganda. We will not censor discussion of the Ukrainian far right or other problems in Ukrainian society, but we may consider gross exaggerations of these problems as propaganda aimed at providing rhetorical cover for the Russian state's imperialist aggression. We may view links to Russian state-affiliated media as "purposeful misinformation" or "messages promoting or encouraging pseudoscience, conspiracism, or breaks with reality" as itemized earlier. We may also view posts supporting NATO and/or Ukrainian nationalism as "messages glorifying the nation state and/or militarism".

    Analogizing Israel and Nazi Germany. We support the self-determination of the Palestinian people as well as the destruction of the ethnonationalist Israeli state, alongside all states, and we are glad to host content celebrating Palestinians' anti-colonial struggle and denouncing Israeli atrocities. Rhetoric comparing Israelis and/or Zionists to the historic German Nazis, however, is as unnecessary and unhelpful as it is insulting to Jews, including anti-Zionist Jewish comrades. We consider it a form of "chauvinistic and bigoted discourse" as itemized earlier.

    Astrology. We don’t believe in it but it’s fine.

    USING KOLEKTIVA.SOCIAL

    BLOCKING AND MUTING

    We encourage users to make use of the block and mute options to help control what content appears on their timelines. While moderators will do our best to block bad offenders and defederate from toxic instances, we recognize that people have different limits and expectations of the fediverse, and these options allow for a more personalized experience. Evading blocks and mutes is not part of respectful engagement, and may lead to suspension and deleting of accounts, and a permanent ban from Kolektiva.social.

    Instructions on how to use personalized Block and Mute controls can be found here.

    REPORTING

    Unlike centralized and corporate social media platforms, the process of moderation on Kolektiva.social is intended to be accountable. The users who make up the moderation team are listed publicly for this reason. We want to receive reports regarding all forms of unacceptable behavior (that we can reasonably respond to), and we will do our best to follow up within a reasonable time frame.

    Instructions on how to report a post can be found here.

    NOTES ON REPORTING

    • Reports made by users on other fediverse instances about Kolektiva.social users are anonymous. For example, if @example@mastodon.online reports a Kolektiva.social user, we will see that a user from Mastodon.online has sent a report, but not their username. We cannot respond to users about their reports if we do not know who they are. We always know which Kolektiva.social users have issued which reports, however.
    • Reports without explanations are significantly harder to follow up on. Links, explanations, and other information are encouraged and appreciated. Furthermore, we cannot reasonably take actions against users when there is no proof of bad behavior or ill intent. Please include examples and/or reasons in your reports.
    • A report does not guarantee the moderation response that you've requested. If reporting users are not satisfied with our decisions, we suggest using the Mute or Block functions.

    ACCESSIBILITY

    We encourage the usage of captions and descriptive text when posting images, in order to make your posts more accessible to users who use screen readers. For the same reason, we also discourage the usage of excessive emojis or unicode text symbols in posts or usernames.

    Our instance is open to users of any language. The most commonly spoken language among Kolektiva.social mods and admins is English, but we can also communicate in French, Haitian Creole, Portuguese and Spanish. Unfortunately, members of our moderation team won’t be able to effectively communicate in other languages apart from those listed above.

    If contacted by users speaking other languages, we may seek out help from other Kolektiva.social users or the admins and mods of other instances. Barring that, we may make use of online translation software.

    SAFETY AND DANGER ON THE FEDIVERSE

    The Kolektiva.social moderation team is made up of relative newcomers to the fediverse, but we understand that all of the problems associated with other online spaces are also present here. Some of these problems relate to surveillance by institutions that aim for social control, and some relate to the forms of oppressive and anti-social behavior that permeate broader society. Most of the members of our collective are anarchists who have been involved in social movements for years. That is to say, we understand a few things about how repression works. We also know how and why anarchists get into fights with one another, because we have been in a few fights ourselves. At the same time, there’s lots that we don’t know.

    As a group, we can draw on a pretty wide array of experiences, but some problems around technical security are simply very complicated, and the same is true of some of the controversies that unfold in local scenes, or over the Internet in general. We will do our best to address issues as they come up. But because we are real people who live in this constantly changing world, we are likely to make mistakes. We also simply won't be able to satisfy all the (sometimes competing) requests and reports that we receive from users.

    We believe that it is imperative that anarchists and social movements abandon surveillance capitalist platforms. In fact, we think everyone on Earth should abandon these services. Platforms like Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, and Twitter spy on us, hand our personal data over to hostile forces, and help to poison political discourse through monetized algorithms and the spread of reactionary ideologies. We want Kolektiva.social to be able to serve as a landing pad for people who are new to Mastodon, the fediverse, etc. For this reason, we are intentionally set up as a large, welcoming instance with open registrations. We have no interest in hosting fascists or other annoying and miserable people (and will ban them once we have a good reason to do so), but obviously some of the people on this platform may be ruder, rougher, and less sensitive than those found on smaller, more community-focused Mastodon/Hometown instances. When we talk about a mass exodus from corporate social media, we recognize that this will involve all sorts of people, and not just those who we already agree with. To paraphrase Maurice Moe Mitchell: we have a low bar to entry and a high standard for conduct.

    We want to allow people to learn how they want to conduct themselves before removing them. That said, even though we intend to be open and welcoming, we will not allow arguments around "free speech" to serve as cover for harmful, entitled, and/or obnoxious behavior. We are aware of the broad conversations taking place around anti-Blackness and other forms of racism on the fediverse, and we take this seriously.

    While we see it as important to provide a space where users can be themselves and reach out to others as they wish, repeatedly posting unsolicited opinions on other people's posts, playing “devil's advocate” with strangers, and other similar forms of obnoxious behavior have their limit, before they become a pattern. If you are having problems with a specific user, please feel free to reach out to one of our moderators for help with explaining microaggressions and subtly oppressive behaviors.

    DEFEDERATING FROM OTHER INSTANCES

    We will do our best to remain defederated from the most toxic parts of the fediverse, and will attempt to keep up-to-date on collective initiatives such as #fediblock. But to maintain Kolektiva.social's usefulness as a communications tool and social media platform, we don’t intend to defederate from large instances based on the actions of a small minority of their membership. We also don’t want to turn defederation into our activism.

    Given Kolektiva.social’s relatively large size on the fediverse (and especially in the “anarchist neighborhood”), we recognize that any decisions that we take to defederate from a given instance can severely limit that instance’s users’ ability to learn about, and engage with, various worthwhile sorts of information that Kolektiva.social users are putting onto the fediverse. Because of this, we will rely more heavily on suspending and silencing individual accounts, unless the instance itself is irredeemable. We will do our best to maintain open lines of communications with other admins, and to pass on reports about their users where we deem it necessary/appropriate.

    A NOTE ON DECENTRALIZATION

    We are aware of the criticism of large centralized Mastodon instances, and the arguments for a more decentralized network of smaller Mastodon servers. We are sympathetic to these criticisms for a number of reasons, not least of which being that they often come from our fellow anarchists. We encourage our users to find another instance that they find fits their expectations and views, or barring that, to create their own.

    That said, we also see a need for large instances with open registration that can serve as landing pads for those escaping from corporate social media platforms. This is a role that we see Kolektiva.social filling as we move forward with our short-term goals. We will continue to assess our role in the fediverse moving forward, and are open to dialogue with other groups about what this can and should look like. As noted earlier, we plan on producing a series of resources aimed at helping people set up and manage their own Mastodon instances.

    A BRIEF HISTORY OF KOLEKTIVA

    Kolektiva was launched in June of 2020 by anarchist media collectives Antimídia and subMedia with the aim of developing autonomous, digital communication infrastructure for the movements we support and participate in. It soon expanded into an informal organization with members based in a handful of places all around the world. Kolektiva's first project was a PeerTube instance, Kolektiva.media.

    Its purpose was to offer a free, non-corporate platform for anarchists and anti-colonial content producers looking to bypass Google, Facebook, and other surveillance capitalist firms, as well as censorship mandated and enforced by governments. When Facebook began purging a number of pages associated with anarchist and antifascist projects in July 2020, Kolektiva set up a Mastodon instance, Kolektiva.social. It has grown rapidly since then, thanks in large part to its open registrations and the increasingly widespread and apparent need for alternatives to the dominant social media platforms. It is important to note that Kolektiva.social started as an ad hoc response to a specific problem, mainly related to the ability of social movements to broadcast information publicly, in the context of the summer's rebellion, and that none of the Kolektiva team were, at that time, especially familiar with the fediverse, from a social point of view, when we started this instance.

    There were controversies, arguments, and accusations. So, as we entered 2021, Kolektiva.social began an (ongoing) effort to expand our number of moderators and to clarify our expectations of users, and users’ expectations of us. Kolektiva.social is just one component of a larger project that is aimed at getting as many people off of corporate social media as possible, and especially people who are involved in anti-colonial, anti-capitalist, and anti-fascist movements. It is also a volunteer project, and time is limited. As a result, we expect it to take us a while to really get a handle of what we're trying to accomplish here, how we should try to accomplish it, and what exactly is within our capacities. Nevertheless, we don't intend to go anywhere, and we are committed to learning from our mistakes and always improving on past failures.

    THE GOALS OF KOLEKTIVA

    Kolektiva exists to provide digital infrastructure for anarchist and anti-colonial movements. We seek to enable as many people as possible to share news and information without relying on centralized and intensively surveilled platforms. We are motivated in this work by the principle of internationalism, and a desire to increase communication and collaboration across state-imposed borders and linguistic divides.

    In the coming years, we hope to scale up the project in a number of ways by doing all of the following:

    1. encouraging the exodus of anarchists and other anti-capitalists/anti-colonialists from corporate platforms towards independent, open-source alternatives such as those offered by Kolektiva
    2. producing instructional videos for new users, and resources for those seeking to set up their own fediverse sites/instances
    3. building up our physical server infrastructure and technical capacity
    4. expanding and diversifying our moderation team
    5. experimenting with other ActivityPub platforms, such as Mobilizon and Pixelfed
    6. introducing a new framework to better organize content and facilitate translation

    DONATIONS

    Donations are welcome and appreciated. They help support the autonomous technical infrastructure. You can Donate Here.

    TOR Onion Address

    This server is available over Tor at: http://klktvbm66ijfy5j7oflsidtcf3gbhrmbaaqfufxggflfb57rv5yakxqd.onion

Description:
“闭社”，谐音“毕设”，正式解释是封闭社交 ，非正式解释是自闭社交 ，是一个氛围友好、注重隐私、数据自主的非官方校内封闭平台。

在这里，你可以讨论不愿在公共平台上讨论的校内热点，也可以记录和分享校园生活，寻找同好。

我们最初建立闭社，是源于当时常见的“某些清华人把知乎当校内BBS用”的吐槽。但现在我们更加致力于保持这里是一个可以畅所欲言、氛围极其友善的温馨后花园。

我们不喜欢炒作和煽情，只想踏踏实实打造一个让大家用着舒服的平台。

同时，更广义的闭社也是一个分布式的高校平台联盟，已经陆陆续续有十余所海内外高校的独立团队自发加盟。每个站点都是由来自对应学校的的团队自主独立运营，使用自己的服务器和域名。在发布内容时，可以选择仅本站可见还是允许跨站。

Description:
Welcome to Hachyderm.io

Pronounced hack-a-derm like pachyderm. (What is a pachyderm?)

Non-User Accounts Restricted

Please also see "Note for Non-User Accounts" at the bottom of this page

Many accounts for non-users are restricted and/or invite-only on this server. This includes but is not limited to: companies, businesses, business-like entities, events, publications, projects, agencies, bots, and so on. Please refer to our Account Types Documentation and reach out to the admin team ( admin@hachyderm.io ) prior to creating an account if you are creating an account for anything other than yourself for personal use.

About

Here we are trying to build a curated network of respectful professionals in the tech industry around the globe. Welcome anyone who follows the rules and needs a safe home or fresh start.

We are hackers, professionals, enthusiasts, and are passionate about life, respect, and digital freedom. We believe in peace and balance.

Safe space. Tech Industry. Economics. OSINT. News. Rust. Linux. Aurae. Kubernetes. Go. C. Infrastructure. Security. Black Lives Matter. LGTBQIA+. Pets. Hobbies.

Community Links

Learn more about our Community by looking at:

  • Community Docs
  • Blog
  • GitHub Community Issue Tracker
  • 💞🐘Current Emojis 🐘💞

Funding

Hachyderm is funded via the Hachyderm project GitHub Sponsor page as well as other donation sources. Please see our Funding and Thank You documentation page for more information about additional ways to donate.

Moderation and Community Safety

Hachyderm is actively moderated to protect our most vulnerable members. Our primary rule is Don't Be A Dick and all other rules are to capture common "whataboutisms" that we want to clearly state are included by Don't Be A Dick. Our server rules, including Don't Be A Dick, are explained on our Community Docs.

When making moderation decisions, our moderators abide by our Moderator Covenant. This is to both hold ourselves accountable as well as provide transparency, and build community trust, around how we handle issues that might appear to fall into "grey areas".

If you experience an issue that needs moderator action / intervention, please look at our documentation page for how to report issues to the moderators.

Reporting Hachyderm Issues and Outages

Technical issues with the Hachyderm site, including full / partial outages and features that are not working correctly, need to be reported to us via our GitHub Community Issue Tracker.

New to Mastodon?

If you're new to Mastodon in general, we recommend taking a look at Mastodon.Help's brief explainer about what Mastodon is and isn't, as well as taking a look at fedi.tips for some How To Dos.

Note for Non-User Accounts

Also referred to as Specialized Accounts in our Documentation

Although regular user accounts are only subject to regular server rules, specialized / entity / "novelty" / "focus" accounts have some additional restrictions. To learn more, please see our Account Types documentation page. A short summary of what to know:

  • Company, company-like, and/or business accounts, currently known as corporate accounts, are invite-only. Unofficial corporate accounts will be suspended.
    • Anyone looking to create an account of this type must reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Those looking to create accounts for non-profit entities should reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Bot accounts are allowed with restrictions (please see our Bot Account documentation).
  • Qualifying Open Source Project accounts are allowed (please see our OSS Project and Community Events documentation).
  • Qualifying Community Events are allowed (please see our OSS Project and Community Events documentation).
  • Essentially: anyone interested in creating an account that is not a general user should reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Large / Influencer account set ups and transfers, which is defined as more than 10k on any platform, need to reach out to the Admin team prior to transfer at admin@hachyderm.io.

For more information about all of the above, please see our Account Types documentation.

Unrecognized specialized account types will be suspended. Commonly suspended / unrecognized subtypes are:

  • NSFW / 18+
  • Fundraising
  • Unofficial company / corporate accounts

This is not an exhaustive list. If you are unsure if the specific specialized account you have in mind is allowed, please reach out to us at admin@hachyderm.io.

Our Logo

Our logo was designed by the lovely Ashton Rainbows. (website, Instagram)

Thank you Ashton!

Nivenly Discord

The Nivenly Foundation is the new (2023) parent organization for Hachyderm. You can join Nivenly's Discord here.

Description:
Follow @geton@theblower.au for server news, status updates, planned downtimes, etc. DM is currently the preferred method of communication with the staff.

Please read our privacy policy.

If you're able and willing to support us financially, all the ways you can do so are here: chinwag.au/theblower

Eligibility

You must be aged 13 years or older to register for an account. We do not require you to use any particular language whilst using the service.

Brands

The Blower is a community, not a billboard or a bullhorn. As such, we do not allow brands to register accounts. Brands are invited to join another instance or create their own – try brands.town. Use these guidelines for what we consider a Brand:

  • If you are a for-profit business, you are a brand
  • If you are a political party, you are a brand

If you are unsure whether you are a brand, please email admin@theblower.au to sort it out before registering.

Bot accounts

Bot accounts (i.e., those with automated posting) are permitted on The Blower under these additional conditions:

  • Post privacy must be set to "unlisted", "followers only" , or "direct"
  • The “This is a bot account” checkbox must be set in the profile.
  • The account must identify the bot owner in the bio.
  • Bots must not interact with (mention) other accounts unless those accounts have interacted with the bot first.

We reserve the right to refuse or revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

User Code of Conduct (Rules)

The following types of content will be removed, and will result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service: Registering accounts with inherently malicious intent.

  • Unauthorised distribution of any personal information or data (DOXing).
  • Impersonation: You may not impersonate individuals, groups, or organisations in a manner that is intended to or does mislead, confuse, or deceive others. While you may maintain parody, fan, commentary accounts, you may not do so if the intent of the account is to engage in spamming or abusive behaviour. (Parody accounts must be labelled as such in the bio).
  • Nude or pornographic images, or other content that would be considered "18+" or "adult" by a reasonable person under Australian law
  • Any conduct intended to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed.
  • Racism or advocacy of racism.
  • Queerphobia, or advocacy of queerphobia (comparisons to paedophilia, animals, dehumanising language)
  • Sexism or advocacy of sexism.
  • Anti-sex worker perspectives or advocation against sex workers.
  • Discrimination or advocation against genders and sexual minorities.
  • Homophobia, Biphobia & Transphobia (Trans Rights are Human Rights).
  • Ableism, fatphobia or discrimination against disabled people.
  • Xenophobia and/or violent nationalism.
  • Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions.
  • Promotion or encouragement of suicide or self-harm.
  • Stalking; including advocating any physical, sexual, or emotional harm against individuals or groups.
  • Harassment of any kind, including consistent baiting, bad faith gaslighting, unwanted sexual advances, etc. especially towards marginalised groups.
  • Promotion of scams, including web3/crypto and other ponzi schemes.

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

  • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism (Seriously. Absolutely no Nazis!).
  • Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism, or similar content illegal in the state of Victoria, Germany, Switzerland and/or France.
  • Violence: You may not make specific threats of violence or wish for the serious physical harm, death, or disease of an individual or group of people. This includes, but is not limited to, threatening or promoting terrorism. You also may not affiliate with organisations that — whether by their own statements or activity both on and off the platform — use or promote violence against civilians to further their causes.
  • Child exploitation: You may not post (or promote) suggestive depictions of children in any way (regardless of context). Example: No bath photos

Content Warning (CW) Guidelines

We encourage the use of Content Warnings (aka Content Wrappers, aka Summaries, aka Topics, aka Subject lines, hereafter CWs) on your posts. CWs are a courtesy to your readers and other members of The Blower community. CWs are not self-censorship: they do not suppress the indexing of posts, only their initial visibility.

The Blower believes that CWs are an important tool to support people's self-autonomy, but they can also be used for expression and creativity.

CWs are not expected on posts made by marginalised people about their own marginalisation, though authors may choose to do so.

Safety and Moderation

We strive to be a welcoming, and safe instance. Mastodon has safety features such as word/hashtag filtering to limit visibility to unwanted content, and we encourage the use of block/muting other accounts rather than engaging in vitriolic arguments. Please make use of the ability to report accounts that break the rules.

Please report users who break following the code of conduct, but please do not message people on behalf of the moderation team. Instead, you can scroll on, block, mute, or report to let moderators deal with it.

We will not act on complaints regarding:

  • Criticising racist, sexist, or otherwise oppressive behaviour or assumptions.
  • Good faith and non-malicious conduct whose object is to ameliorate (improve) the conditions of disadvantaged individuals or groups.
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as “leave me alone,” “go away,” or “I’m not discussing this with you”.
  • Swearing or profanity.

The Blower is one of many Fediverse communities, each with their own rules, moderation, and ethos. You are able to move servers in the future without losing your followers if this instance turns out to not be the best place for you.

Description:
LGBTQ+ friendly furry instance

🦊🐺🐶🐯🐱🦝🐉

Show off your canine pride at bark.lgbt. A alternative to meowing at meow.social

Credit for custom emoji's:

  • https://volpeon.ink/
  • https://github.com/chr-1x/dragn-emoji

File a DMCA complaint

Report the post in question or send a email to admin@bark.lgbt. We take these claims very seriously and will come back to you within a day

bark.lgbt team

Announcements: @bark

Admins:

  • @dalite
  • @cisco

Moderators:

  • @wesleyote

  • You? - reach out to admin today if you would like to help us moderate this instance.

📜 Rules

We want everyone on this instance to feel comfortable expressing themselves. That being said there are limits. We have zero tolerance for any blatant homophobia / transphobia / trolling / hating and in general just people that are here to ruin the mood. We are lgbt+ run and supportive.

Registering an account on this instance means you are at least 16 years old. Additionally you agree that browsing the timelines from this instance might expose you to not-safe-for-work and other unwanted material. This is due to the nature of the fediverse. You agree to report these posts so our moderator team can take actions against the violating instance or user.

If you are under the age of 18 years old we highly recommend making use of filters https://bark.lgbt/filters to filter out commonly used hashtags in NSFW, i.e. #nsfw

If your account is identified as being younger than 18 years old and you are seen posting NSFW content your account will be suspended. This falls under illegal content.

We accept the posting of NSFW content however to protect other instances feeds we require not safe for work (NFSW) content to be tagged appropriately. Use both a content warning (CW) and blur media if any media is attached. If this is violated your post may be removed and repeated violation of this rule will result in a ban.

Profile pictures and profile headers MUST be PG-13 and cannot be NSFW / explicit. If your profile is found to violate this rule our moderators will remove your profile picture and/or header. You are then free to upload a alternative that does adhere to this rule.

Zoophillia is not accepted on this instance, nor any mention of it.

This is not a exhaustive list of rules and by registering to this instance you agree that we can add, remove or modify rules without prior notice. If you are in breach of one of our rules our moderator team will contact you and attempt to resolve the situation. If you are uncooperative we may choose to suspend your account on this instance.

🐺 Acceptable content

While we are (canine) furry focused everyone is welcome to join in the howl! No matter your species. Non-furry content is allowed as well, do keep in mind to CW your posts if they include anything you don't want to see in public, Especially NSFW!

See something? Say something! Use the report feature to report posts and our team will review them on a case-by-case basis. All reports will be handled fairly for all parties involved.

💬 Languages

While we are a primary English speaking instance we do offer translations for the following languages:

  • Czech
  • Dutch
  • French
  • German
  • Italian
  • Spanish

When you create a post you can specify which language you are typing your post in. Choosing one of the above languages will offer users of this instance a 'translate' button to automatically translate your posts content into English

📢 Fediblock policy

Our team regularly monitors the #fediblock hashtag and acts accordingly. Additionally if we identify a malicious instance our team will announce this to #fediblock.

We obscure the names of all instances that are suspended/silenced. If you suspect we have blocked your instance and you want to appeal then please contact our team via email [admin@bark.lgbt]

🖋️ GDPR Policy

If you own a account on our instance you have the ability to export all the data this instance has of you, as well as request complete account deletion.

  • Export your data
  • Delete your data

💰 Donations

Are you feeling generous? Did we do an amazing job with something? Or are you just enjoying the service we're offing?

We are private individuals operating this instance not-for-profit. We will never sell your data and never show advertisements on our instance.

Donations are always most welcome as these will assist us with paying monthly infrastructure fees. Donations are not mandatory but are greatly appreciated. Donations will be shared on @bark as well. We want to let everyone know the money we receive is being put into the instance, be it infrastructure improvements or compensation to our moderators (instance owner excluded)

  • ko-fi

🔍 Information we store about you

When you choose to register an account on this instance we keep minimal information needed to make the site function for you on our systems. This includes, but is not limited to:

  • Your IP
  • Your email
  • Language
  • Most recent activity
  • Statistics about your account, namely:
    • Amount of posts
    • Media storage usage
    • Reports made and reported by others
    • Follower information

This information is collected to assist our moderators and create aggregate instance usage data.

System logs are only stored for up to an hour for troubleshooting purposes.

Description:
FAQ

What is Sigmoid Social?

Sigmoid Social is a Mastodon instance for people researching, working on, or just interested in AI. We went live on 11/04/2022.

Who should join Sigmoid Social?

You should join Sigmoid Social if you would like to be part of a Mastodon community primarily focused on discussing AI. We do not gatekeep who can join; it does not matter whether you are a researcher, engineer, hacker, student, artist, or just curious.

Who runs Sigmoid Social?

Sigmoid Social is administered and maintained by The Gradient. The Gradient is a non-profit and volunteer-run organization with the mission of facilitating discussion within the AI community. We were founded in 2017 by a group of students and researchers at the Stanford AI Lab. Our current projects include The Gradient Magazine, The Gradient Podcast, The Update newsletter, and Sigmoid Social.

Should I only post about AI?

You can feel free to toot about anything at all, as long as it complies with the Code of Conduct. We may however ask you to migrate to a different instance if your focus is not AI at all.

Should I only post in English?

This server supports translation, so it is ok to post in other languages than English. But, as English as the primary language here, that should ideally be the primary language you use. If you do post in other languages, please tag your posts with the appropriate language label.

Will you ban me for X?

We will take appropriate moderation measures against any violations of the Code of Conduct. We also reserve the right to take actions in the best interest of the community in situations we deem harmful but do not clearly violate the Code of Conduct. We will generally lean towards promoting free expression and issuing warning and restrictions rather than bans, but this is absolutely not a free-speech-above-all platform.

How can I help cover costs?

You can support us on Patreon or Kofi!

How can I share suggestions for Sigmoid Social?

You can message The Gradient via Mastodon, email, Twitter, or pigeon.

Where is my data stored?

Sigmoid Social is hosted by MastHost, a fully managed Mastodon hosting service provided by WAP – Web Access Platforms. WAP is a one-person company 100% owned and administrated by Hugo Gameiro. All data storage and processing is done through MastHost.

What happens if The Gradient can no longer maintain Sigmoid Social?

In the case that our current team can no longer run Sigmoid Social, we will attempt to transfer control of it to another non-profit entity within the AI community. If we are unable to do this, we will announce the closure of Sigmoid Social within at least 30 days to allow users to transfer their accounts to other Mastodon instances.

Can you access my private DMs?

The only way we can access private communications from Sigmoid Social is through exporting the database stored by MastoHost. We will do this periodically for the purpose of storing backups, and in case we have to migrate to another hosting solution. We will not inspect the database for any other reasons. Regardless, we recommend not sharing any private or secure information on this platform.

What is your policy in AI Art and NFTs?

This instance is a great fit for anyone who wants to post AI art - we fully support it. We are also OK with NFT promotion, as long as it relates to AI art and is not spammy.

Why does the banner spell out "Sigmioid"

We generated our banner using MidJourney (a text-to-image AI tool), and intentionally picked out an image that contained a typo as a little in-joke about these tools.

Recommended Practices & Mastodon tips

Here are some recommended practices for helping make Sigmoid Social a great place for everyone here:

  • Browse the local feed when starting out. Mastodon has three types of feeds: home (people or hashtags you follow), local (all posts from this instance), and federated (all posts from this instance and any users from other instances that are follow by anyone on here). Until you follow some people or hashtags, the local feed is your best bet for discovering content.
  • Use hashtags. Mastodon does not have an algorithmic feed, so hashtags are often used for finding content relevant to your interests. So, using hashtags will make it easier for others to find and follow you, and for you to find others as well. We list a set of recommended hashtags below!
  • Use the unlisted privacy setting in replies and threads. The default post privacy in Mastodon is 'global', which gets posted to the local timeline, whereas 'unlisted' is only shown when browsing the replies to a given post. Using unlisted for most replies and threads makes the timeline less cleaner and nicer to browse.
  • Look into the non-official apps for Mastodon. There are some apps not made by Mastodon that provide an arguably better frontend. Examples include Tusky and Toot!
  • Consider using content warnings/content labels. The CW button when writing posts stands for 'content warning', and then you include one in your post only the text for it is shown unless a user presses a button to see the rest of the post. We recommend using it for sensitive content, but you can also use them like a subject line or TLDR as well!
  • Explore Mastodon notification options. Mastodon allows you to mute various types of notifications, which can make it easier to focus on just replies and ignore favorites or boosts if you prefer to do so.
  • Report any content you think might violate the code of conduct. Moderation on Mastodon primarily relies on the users reporting objectionable content, at which point our mods can take care of it. Reporting bad content will make the experience on Sigmoid Social better for everyone!
  • Aim to be generally civil and friendly :)

Hashtags

As is true for Mastodon in general, we recommend you use hashtags in your posts. The following are just some you may want to use:

  • #introduction - for introducing yourself!
  • #ai - for stuff related to AI!
  • #NewPaper - for sharing new papers!
  • #PaperThread - for threads summarizing your or others' papers!
  • #arxiv- for stuff related to arxiv!

Code of Conduct

Sigmoid Social is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone.

We want this community to maintain a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. In keeping with these aims, we do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from Sigmoid Social at the discretion of the organizers of the Gradient.

Harassment, including the following activities, will not be tolerated:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, age, race, or religion.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person’s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of ‘dead’ or rejected names.
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they’re not appropriate.
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or “backrub“) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence.
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
  • Deliberate intimidation.
  • Stalking or following.
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes.
  • Sustained disruption of discussion.
  • Unwelcome sexual attention.
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others. Sigmoid Social is intended to be a welcoming platform, so while friendships in support of research are encouraged, note that Sigmoid Social is not a dating platform. Flirting or other unprofessional behavior may make someone uncomfortable. If a member requests another member to stop this type of behavior and it continues, it will be considered harassment.
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease.
  • Deliberate "outing" of any aspect of a person’s identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse.
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication.
  • Impersonation with the intent to deceive users (satire is ok).
  • Explicitly rude or degrading remarks in general.

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a user of Sigmoid Social, notice that someone else is being harassed, believe confidentiality has been violated, or have any other concerns, please report this via the standard Mastodon tools. We will respond as promptly as we can.

organizers reserve the right to exclude people from Sigmoid Social based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Sigmoid Social.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom we’ve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them, if we believe that doing so will increase the safety of the members Sigmoid Social or the general public. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the organizers may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from Sigmoid Social and identification of the participant as a harasser to other members of Mastodon.

CMX.IM是长毛象(Mastodon)的一个中文实例。Mastodon 是一个开源的、符合 GNU Social 规范的去中心化社交网络，整个长毛象社区是由无数实例组成的。注册本社区后你不仅可以与本实例内的用户互动，并且可以与来自世界各地的其他实例中的用户无缝连接。

长毛象中文站是一个开放，友好，有爱的社区。长毛象中文站主题为喵、汪、各种动物、社交、科技、编程及生活。我们欢迎友好、热情、乐于分享的朋友，无论你的兴趣点是什么。

社区规则

这里不是圣斗士的角斗场，也不是犯罪分子的窝点。为了您安家后的使用体验，请详细阅读长毛象中文站社区规则。

如果你不喜欢本站的主题或发言规则，可以从Instance List中选择更适合你的实例。记住，除非你选择实例明确阻隔了其他某个或某些实例，你永远可以和整个Mastodon社区的用户交互。

使用指南

Mastodon 中文官方文档 (备用地址)

长毛象中文站博客

Mastodon 的去中心化设计防止了社交数据被少数公司或团体垄断的风险，也大大增加了屏蔽及过滤的难度。如果你有兴趣动手搭建一个实例，请参考官方文档。

你可以随时导出备份自己的数据并申请转移到其他实例中而无需担心因为实例运营者的问题导致的数据丢失。如果你有更多关于Mastodon的问题，请参考官方中文文档。

本站原则上只使用官方 Stable 代码，所有包括汉化等问题将在 Github 上提交。有编程经验的朋友不妨加入我们一起来让长毛象更萌，更可爱吧。

免翻墙备用镜像站

我们提供备用地址，特供不方便使用VPN的中国用户不需翻墙访问本站。请登录后在网页版的站内公告栏获取免翻墙备用地址与使用方式。

镜像站点域名使用特别说明：如果你的用户名为 example，那么 @example@m.cmx.im 是你的主ID， @example@cmx-im.work 是你的从属ID，备用ID不具备单独运作的能力。其他用户@你的从属ID可以解析到你的主ID。

About
日本語

Aethy is a safe haven for creative and unique people and communities to flourish! This server is for people to be able to express themselves by sharing their creations, talk about their interests, or just be themselves in an environment that doesn't allow harassment to flourish. In contrast to other environments online, we also want to be a safe space for marginalized individuals including queer folks, people of color, and women by disallowing hateful speech and ideals.

As advertisers become prevalent in online spaces, many sites limit what type of content is allowed in order to appease them. From banning nudity all the way to banning strange and niche kinks! By contrast, Aethy embraces and loves the human body! We love when adults get kinky and sometimes downright strange with their sexuality! We don't believe in regressive ideologies that limit creative speech and content between consenting adults. With that belief in mind, we made Aethy. The policies were envisioned and sculpted by people who've dealt with hate all their lives, as well as experiencing mental, physical, and sexual abuse (both as minors and as adults). It's extremely important to us that we create a safe space for our community so we've built the site on the principles of inclusion and consent.

Instead of continuing to be squeezed out of spaces because perhaps we're too weird, too queer, or too kinky... we've made our own space! We don't think there's any wrong way to express ourselves as long as we adhere to the principles of consent and inclusion! We no longer want to inhabit spaces where we're beholden to advertisers, puritans and those that wish to spread hate!

Check out our Matrix Space!

Donate

FAQ

Content Warnings

What is a or "CW?"

or a "CW" is short for "Content Warning". When a user is making a post, they have the option to click a button that has a symbol. This is used to warn other users about content they might not wish to see (such as sexual or violent content).

What content needs a ?

Public and Unlisted Posts that contain sexual themes, gore, and depictions/discussions of sensitive topics require warnings. Any media where the intent is to arouse is included in this (even if a censor bar or a blur effect is applied). This also includes images where the subject is posed in a sexual manner, or if a body part is framed in an attempt to be arousing. Light blood doesn't require a but beyond that, a is most likely required. Finally, sensitive topics include politics, religion, spirituality, niche belief systems, abuse (including relationship which would be abusive in reality), current events and other topics that could potentially upset someone.

Just do your best though! No one is gonna get in trouble unless they're intentionally trying to upset other users!

What happens if I forget to add a ?

The best thing to do is to quickly edit your post and add one. Otherwise, you'll receive a reminder from a staff member reminding you to add one provided the post content isn't deemed to be too upsetting! Staff members will also typically give suggestions as to what tags may be appropriate. However, if the lack of a on a post could be extremely distressing to viewers, the post may be deleted and need to be redrafted from your email. Accounts that ignore staff warnings may also be Limited so the posts don't appear in public timelines and all images will be marked as "sensitive". To have the Limited status removed, simply edit your posts to include a and then appeal the Limited status. Punitive action will never be taken, we will simply put measures in place to protect other users from content they may wish to avoid!

What if my s aren't good enough?

Try your best! If the s aren't comprehensive enough, the staff's course of action will be similar to the above. As a general rule of thumb, try to avoid simply marking a post as "NSFW" or something similar. Ask yourself why it's NSFW and list those reasons in the CW. Also avoid overly broad CWs such as "Nudity", "Age Gap", "Dead Dove", etc. Be specific about the subjects and what content is involved!

What's an example of a ?

Examples for sexual content are "Kink", "Sex", "Sexual Nudity", "Boner", "Erection", "Het", "GL", “BL”, “MLM”, “Anal”, “Blowjob”, “Boner”, “Blood”, “Gore”, “Vore”, “Macro”, "Age gap", “Underage”, "Shota", "Loli", “Minor/Adult”, "Teen/Adult", etc.

An example for a heavier topic could include "Politics", "Hate Speech", "Harassment", "Discourse", "Syscourse", etc.

When it comes to religion, spirituality and niche belief systems and frameworks, some examples are "Spirituality, "Religion", "Otherkin", "Therian", "Christian", "Jesus", etc.

Basically, the more specific you can get, the better! But you also don't have to make an essay out of it! However, please avoid using loaded words that can be used synonymously with real abuse as s. s are meant to allow people to avoid content they don't wish to see and should do so without causing distress to others.

Does simple nudity require a ?

Nope! Content warnings are not required for non-sexual nudity (e.g. images that don't feature close-ups of genitals, boners, or sex acts). Basically, if it's an image you'd find in an art museum or if the intention of the content isn't to arouse, it doesn't need a . This policy doesn't discriminate against age or body type either. If the subject is a real adult and has consented, or if it's a fictional drawing, then nudity is no different than if the subject is clothed! This also means images that contain nudity can be used in profile icons and banners!

You’re still free to use content warnings when they’re not required, however!

What counts as sexual or erotic?

Any image where the intent is to arouse or where the subjects featured are engaged in a sexual act. This may even include images that don't feature sexual nudity such as images that contain bodily fluids or where the subject(s) are posed in a sexual nature. It also includes images that attempt to censor the sexual content (e.g. placing a bar over a boner or blurring it). Basically, if it's obvious what's going on, it needs a !

Can I boost content from another server that doesn't have a ?

Yes! We don't want to discourage interacting with other servers even when their policies relating to s differ from ours. Users are encouraged to proceed with caution when viewing posts from other servers. However, if a post isn't marked as "sensitive" when it would be required to have a on Aethy, please report it so we can mark it ourselves!

Acceptable Content

Can I post content I don't own the rights to?

This isn't legal advice but typically screenshots, cropped comic panels, clips from television, etc. fall under Fair Use in the United States. This also includes fan art, fan fiction, and other such content. Staff members will not typically remove content from mass media properties that we believe to fall under Fair Use. However, if a user uploads full television episodes or movies, copyrighted music, and other such content, it will be removed and the user suspended as it is not Fair Use. Also, when it comes to independent creators, we ask that you do not repost their creations (e.g. artwork, photos, videos, etc.) without the creator's permission. We also ask that you don't include their characters in your creations in a way that could cause duress (e.g. drawing sexual imagery of someone's mascot character without their permission).

Can I upload works created with AI?

Yes but it must be disclosed. AI assisted works (such as art where background elements are created by AI) simply require disclosure of the tool used in the post body. However, when posting works created entirely (or nearly entirely) by AI, a must be added indicating that it's AI generated and what tool was used to create it. However, works that were created by directly modifying someone else's copyrighted content may not be posted unless the original content falls under Fair Use. The AI used must also have been trained in a clean room environment that wasn't trained using real human subjects. Especially in the case of pictures featuring underage characters.

Hello Friend 👋

Warmest welcome to all new users! It is all about people - Follow people, make new friends, connect with old ones. toot.io is a fast and reliable Mastodon instance running since 2018. You can sign-up and use it for free!

Funding 💸

Mastodon hosted by toot.io offers hosting services to cover the costs of this instance. Yes, you can have your own Mastodon instance. We give a portion of the net revenue to the Mastodon developers on an ongoing basis.

We don't sell your data to advertisers or other third parties. There are no ads. If you enjoy toot.io and find it useful, you can donate here: Patreon. Many thanks!

Moderation 🎤

To reach mods please use the Mastodon reporting feature.

Spam Prevention ✅

Preferably use the Mastodon verification feature. https://joinmastodon.org/verification

Code of Conduct ℹ️

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of toot.io; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or Japan
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

When you'll sign up, you'll be following a few accounts by default. But you are free to follow and unfollow anyone!

THIS INSTANCE'S DATA WILL NOT BE SOLD OR TRADED OR WHATEVER.

برای مشاهده اطلاعات آماری سرور اینجا کلیک کنید

  

درباره سرور ایرانی های ماستودون

با درود به شما که داری این متن رو میخونی.

 

خلاصه ای درباره این سرور( نمونه)

این ماستودون فارسی، یا پرشین ماستودون یک سرور تحت ماستودون (مستودون) اصلی ساخته شده و برای ارتباط فارسی (پارسی) زبانان در سراسر دنیا هست. به عبارتی این ماستودون ایرانی محلی برای ارتباطات ایرانیان در سرتاسر جهان است.

عضویت در این سرور برای عموم آزاد است.

ما هیچ دخل و تصرفی در کد های اصلی ماستودون نداریم و دقیقاً نسخه اصلی را دنبال میکنیم.

ما اطلاعات شما را نمیفروشیم و به هیچ ارگان و دولتی تحویل نخواهیم داد.

ما از هیچ حزب و گروهی حمایت نمیکنیم پس حضور افراد از هر گروه، حزب، نژاد، مذهب و غیره ارتباطی با مدیران سرور ندارد.

ما هیچ سروری در ایران نداریم و نخواهیم داشت.

ما هیچگونه تبلیغی نداریم و نخواهیم داشت.

هزینه نگهداری سرور فعلاً به صورت شخصی بوده و در صورت نیاز به صورت کمک های عمومی خواهد بود.

هرگونه کمک مالی و فنی به ما در خط مشی ما تاثیر گذار نخواهد بود.

حضور پرچم ملی ایران در کنار لوگو اصلی هیچ ارتباطی با جهت گیری سیاسی ندارد و صرفاً پرچم ملی ایران است.

 

تعهدات ما

اولین و مهمترین تعهد ما، تعهد به آزادی بیان در این سرور است. پس مدیران سرور بدون هیچ جهت گیری در این سرور فقط به نظارت اطلاعات عمومی نظارت خواهند داشت که صرفاً تحت قوانین عمومی باشد.

ما به گرفتن بک آپ روزانه از اطلاعات سرور متعهد هستیم. پس در صورت هرگونه اتفاق برای سرور تمام تلاش ما بر حفظ اطلاعات شما خواهد بود.

در صورت تصمیم به بستن سرور، ما متعهد میشویم که این موضوع را حداقل سه ماه زودتر از طریق ایمیل و پیام در سرور به کاربران سرور اطلاع رسانی کنیم تا فرصت مهاجرت اکانت برای کاربران وجود داشته باشد.

ما متعهد هستیم هیچ گونه دسترسی به پیام های شخصی شما نخواهیم داشت، اما در نظر داشته باشید که پیام ها در ماستودون رمز نگاری دو طرفه نیست، پس اگر در ایران هستید برای امنیت خودتان پیشنهاد میکنیم از ارسال پیام های مهم در اینجا خوداری کنید.

 

کاربران

لطفاً در صورتی که تصویر یا محتوای شما شامل مواردی از جمله خشونت و یا غیره میباشد حتماً از گزینه هشدار محتوا CW استفاده کنید.

افزودن فایل های ویروسی و بدافزار برای گمراه کردن و یا دزدی از کاربران ممنوع میباشد و بدون اخطار قبلی حذف خواهد شد.

 

پیشنهادات ما برای استفاده از ماستودون

پیشنهاد اصلی ما استفاده از نسخه وب ماستودون در موبایل و رایانه شخصی هست. چرا که ما از کلید های امنیتی رمز نگاری شده برای ارتباط شما با سرور استفاده میکنیم و این موضوع امنیت شما رو در بالاترین حد ممکن قرار میدهد.

استفاده از اپلیکیشن های غیر رسمی به اندازه نسخه وب امنیت ندارد. برای تبدیل نسخه وب به اپلیکیشن موبایلی در اندروید اینجا و برای تبدیل نسخه وب به اپ آیفون اینجا کلیک کنید. توجه داشته باشید که در این روش همانند نسخه وب در بالاترین حالت امنیت قرار دارید.

 

ربات ها

در صورت ساخت اکانت ربات حتماً پست های اکانت ربات رو به صورت پیشفرض در حالت "فهرست نشده" یا "Unlisted" در نسخه انگلیسی، قرار دهید تا تمامی مطالب منتشر شده توسط ربات به صورت "فهرست نشده" یا "Unlisted" باشد.

 

ارتباط با ما

برای ارتباط با ما میتونید به اکانت مدیر پیام بدید و یا به ایمیل اشاره شده در بالا صفحه ایمیل ارسال کنید.

 

سایر خدمات ما

تیم ما سرویس های دیگری هم برای ارتباطات در سایر پلتفرم ها ارائه میدهد. به عنوان مثال:

 پیکسلفد Pixelfed

پیکسلفد یک پلتفرم غیرمتمرکز همانند ماستودون بر بستر فدیورس (Fediverse) است که سرویسی شبیه به اینستاگرام برای اشتراک گذاری عکس و فیلم میباشد. میتونید برای عضویت در سرور ما (ایرانی های پیکسلفد) بر روی لینک زیر کلیک کنید.

https://persians.life

 

 پیام رسان Element

المنت پیام‌رسانی امن و کاره‌ای برای همکاری گروهی است که برای گپ‌های گروهی هنگام دورکاری، آرمانیست. این کارهٔ گپ برای فراهم کردن کنفرانس ویدیویی، هم‌رسانی پرونده و تماس‌های صوتی، از رمزنگاری سرتاسری استفاده می‌‌کند و همچنین به صورت غیر متمرکز قابل استفاده است. برای استفاده از این سرویس میتوانید در هنگام ورود آدرس m.persians.life را وارد کنید تا به سرور ما متصل شوید. ( در حال حاضر در ایران فیلتر نمیباشد.)

https://m.persians.life

 

About Persians Mastodon server

Greetings to you who are reading this text.

 

Summary about this server (instance)

This server is built under Mastodon and is for the communication of Farsi (Persian) speakers all over the world.

Registration for this instance is open to the public.

We have no interference in the original Mastodon codes and we follow exactly the original version.

We will not sell your information and will not hand it over to any organization or government.

We do not support any party or group, so the presence of people from any group, party, race, religion, etc has nothing to do with the server administrators.

We do not have any servers in Iran and we will not have any.

We do not and will not have any ads.

The cost of maintaining the server is currently personal and if needed, it will be in the form of public donations.

Any financial and technical assistance to us will not affect our policy.

The presence of the national flag of Iran next to the main logo has nothing to do with political orientation and is simply the national flag of Iran.

 

Our Commitments

Our first and most important commitment is the commitment to freedom of expression on this server. So the server administrators will only monitor public information without any direction in this server, which is only under public rules.

We are committed to taking daily backups of server data. So, if anything happens to the server, our best efforts will be to save your information.

If we decide to shut down the server, we undertake to inform the users of the server at least three months in advance through email and messages on the server, so that you have the opportunity to migrate your account to another instance.

We are committed that we will not have any access to your personal messages, but keep in mind that the messages in Mastodon are not two-way encrypted, so if you are currently in Iran For your own safety, we suggest you refrain from sending important messages here.

 

Users

Please be sure to use the CW content warning option if your image or content contains things such as violence or other graphics.

Adding virus and malware files to mislead or steal users' data is prohibited and will be removed without prior warning.

 

Our suggestions for using Mastodon

Our main suggestion is to use the Mastodon web version on mobile and PC. Because we use encrypted security keys for your connection with the server, and this puts your security at the highest possible level.

Using unofficial apps is not as secure as the web version. Convert the web to a personal app on mobile Click here to convert the web version to a mobile app on Android and click here to convert the web version to an iPhone app. Note that in this method you are in the highest security mode as in the web version.

 

Bots

If you create a bot account, be sure to set the posts of the bot account to "Unlisted" by default, so that all the content is published "unlisted" by the robot.

 

Contact us

To communicate with us, you can send a message to the manager's account or send an email to the email indicated at the top of the page.

 

Our other services

Our team also provides other services for communication on other platforms. For example:

 Pixelfed

Pixelfed is a decentralized platform like Mastodon based on Fediverse, which is a service similar to Instagram for sharing photos and videos. You can click on the link below to join our server (Iranian FedEx).

PLEASE READ BEFORE JOINING:

mastodon.art is a safe space instance. We have strict federation policies that protect our most vulnerable members first and foremost, which means we block any instances that host or platform hate (racism, transphobia, etc.).

Mastodon•ART — an inclusive community for creators that prioritises the safety of our marginalised members. We welcome all kinds of creativity: illustration, design, 3D modelling, gamedev, photography, music, writing, performance art, ceramics, typography, sculpture, fibre arts, and more! You're welcome to make •ART your main home on the Fediverse and are welcome to go 'off topic' to post your daily thoughts, witty banter, and friendly communication.

Please read •ART's Code of Conduct (below) and terms of use before signing up. Click here for a list of suggested Mastodon mobile apps. We strive to make •ART a safe and supportive community for everyone with a strong zero-tolerance stance on hate and bigotry. •ART has no ads or algorithms to mess with chronological timelines, and doesn't track you or profit off your data. Brands wishing to make an account here must be respectful by engaging with the local community. Accounts made solely to advertise will be suspended.

•ART is run by members of the community and is not a company trying to profit off of your life and art with ads. As such, your support via LiberaPay, Ko-Fi or Patreon to help pay for hosting and operating costs is greatly appreciated.

Mastodon.ART General Information

Mastodon.ART (•ART) is an independent community-run instance and is not affiliated with the joinMastodon.org (tootsuite) organization. The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administrators and moderators of •ART. They are listed here to provide you with an insight into the site and our moderation policies.
